correctness.rationale: Largely incorrect and not traceable to the article. Key issues: (1) Growth-per-cycle is wrong by unit: article reports 0.22 nm/cycle (2.2 Å/cycle) at 150 °C, but extraction gives 0.22 Å/cycle. (2) Dosing time for DEZ is 4 s in the article; extraction uses 4 ms (should be 4000 ms). (3) Number of cycles (600) is inconsistent with 70 nm thickness and reported GPC; 70 nm at 0.22 nm/cycle implies ~318 cycles, not 600. (4) Electrical properties are misattributed: resistivity 1.85 Ω·cm and mobility 23.8 cm^2/V·s are for water-grown films; PEALD (oxygen plasma) films were too resistive to measure. Extraction also uses wrong resistivity unit (Ω·m) and invents a carrier density value not reported. (5) Many properties are hallucinated/not traceable: optical properties (n, absorption, band gap, Tauc plot), uniformity, conformality, film composition by XPS (not performed), film density, and all TFT device metrics (the article states TFT results will be reported later). (6) Roughness value/unit incorrect: extraction uses 6.3 nm, while the table lists RMS in Å (≈6.3 Å ≈ 0.63 nm). (7) Precursor flow of 160 sccm is cited for thermal ALD; applying it to PEALD DEZ flow is not supported by the text (only O2 = 60 sccm and Ar purge = 80 sccm are stated for PEALD). (8) NucleationPeriod = 1 cycle is not reported and not traceable. Corrections needed: set GPC to 2.2 Å; set DEZ dose to 4000 ms; make cycles consistent with 70 nm (~318) or adjust thickness; remove or mark as not measured all unreported optical/XPS/density/uniformity/conformality/device properties; set PEALD electrical properties to 'too high to measure' rather than numeric values; correct roughness to ~0.63 nm (6.3 Å); remove unsupported DEZ flow value or clearly indicate NA for PEALD.

completeness.rationale: Major incompleteness and factual misalignment. (1) Multiple processes are described in the article but only one is extracted. The article reports both PEALD (O2 plasma) and a separate thermal ALD (H2O) process; the latter (with DEZ 4 s, H2O 2.5 s, Ar 160 sccm, purge 4.5 s; resistivity 1.85 Ω·cm; mobility 23.8 cm2/V·s) must be represented as a second process (method=TALD). (2) Misassigned/incorrect values: the reported resistivity and mobility (for water-grown films) were incorrectly applied to the PEALD process; PEALD films were “too resistive to measure.” A numeric carrier density (1.2e18 m−3) is fabricated. (3) GPC unit/value error and internal inconsistency: article gives 0.22 nm/cycle (≈2.2 Å/cycle), but extraction uses 0.22 Å/cycle and 600 cycles alongside 70 nm thickness (mutually inconsistent). (4) Flow rates: 160 sccm Ar carrier pertains to the thermal ALD comparison, not PEALD; precursor flow for PEALD is not reported and should not be filled with the thermal ALD value. (5) Numerous unreported properties were filled with invented values (refractive index, absorption coefficient, band gap, uniformity, conformality, elemental concentration/atomic ratio via XPS, film density, device metrics such as threshold voltage, subthreshold swing, on/off ratio, device structure, and otherAspects). These are not traceable to the article and violate factual alignment. (6) Nucleation period (set to 1 cycle) is not reported. (7) Roughness values need verification against Table I (units and exact numbers are unclear in the text). Items to add/review: add a second TALD process; correct GPC to 2.2 Å/cycle and reconcile cycles vs thickness; remove or leave blank any properties not reported (or restructure to only include traceable values); assign electrical properties correctly (PEALD: too resistive to measure; thermal ALD: 1.85 Ω·cm and 23.8 cm2/V·s); ensure flow rates map to the appropriate process; verify roughness values and units.
